image.altText: cannabis grow house

props.synopsis: Police say there are some obvious signs of spotting a grow house — residents coming and going at odd hours, lots of electrical infrastructure, overgrown gardens and blacked out windows — as well as the smell of cannabis.

title.children: 'Huge shock' as neighbour learns of an alleged grow house next door

image.altText: A graphic depicts traditional Korean hanbok alongside a Chinese garment and the War Memorial building

props.synopsis: A garment that appears to be of Chinese origin is currently displayed in front of the South Korean flag at the Australian War Memorial — something Korean Australians are demanding is rectified.

title.children: Korean community call on Australian War Memorial to fix 'misleading' display

image.altText: Jacob Vadakkedathu, Peter Dutton

props.synopsis: The Liberals lead Senate candidate for Canberra faces a vote to be disendorsed after being called in for a meeting over claims of branch stacking.

title.children: Liberal Senate candidate faces vote to be disendorsed

image.altText: A Localcoin branded Bitcoin ATM.

props.synopsis: There are dozens of cryptocurrency ATMs in the Canberra region, located across the city and outside it — but what are they for, how have they become so prolific, and who uses them?

title.children: 'Wild west of finance': Why are there cryptocurrency ATMs?

image.altText: Empty desks on the CommSec trading floor, including social distancing signs

props.synopsis: The Fair Work Commission found the man, who believed Microsoft Teams amounted to "illegal video surveillance", had not been bullied at work.

title.children: Lawyer who claimed Microsoft Teams was 'illegal video surveillance' has bullying claim rejected

image.altText: Branches on the road after storms tore them down.

props.synopsis: A major clean-up effort is underway across the ACT and surrounds after a severe thunderstorm on Wednesday night pulled down trees, flooded homes and cut power to hundreds of properties.

title.children: Hail 'as big as golf balls' and thunder strikes Canberra with 110kph wind gusts

image.altText: A man in a blue and white checked button down shirt stands in a mechanic's garage full of buses.

props.synopsis: The manufacturer of four electric buses temporarily pulled from Canberra's public service fleet say the ACT government never raised concerns about the vehicles' range despite citing it as a key reason the vehicles were taken off the roads.

title.children: 'No reports of range concerns' in EV buses pulled from Canberra roads

image.altText: A yellow 'road closed' sign across a road with clothing and other items scattered in the background.

props.synopsis: A motorist who allegedly hit and killed a pedestrian in Jerrabomberra late last year has been charged with causing death by dangerous and negligent driving.

title.children: Woman charged over fatal Jerrabomberra crash that killed mother-of-two

image.altText: Six different hands reach towards a contactless pay point on public transport, each paying in a different way.

props.synopsis: Transport Canberra's new ticketing system was intended to make paying for and planning routes on public transport easier, but almost two months since its rollout some commuters are still struggling to navigate MyWay+.

title.children: 'Still not ready': Commuters struggling to navigate MyWay+

image.altText: Carlos Alcaraz serves at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Aryna Sabalenka, Coco Gauff, Paula Badosa and Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova reach the women's singles quarterfinals on day eight of the Australian Open. Follow live.

title.children: Alcaraz takes centre stage after Sabalenka, Gauff lock in Aus Open quarterfinals

image.altText: A firefighter stands in a burnt door frame

props.synopsis: Some social media users have reported seeing rent increases of $2,000 after fires devastated the Los Angeles area. Here's what we know abou the rent-gouging.

title.children: Reports of rent-gouging after LA fires draws warning from officials

image.altText: A police van and police tape across a suburban street

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to the home on Hobart's eastern shore about 9am. Witnesses described seeing "flames everywhere" and neighbours rushing to help.

title.children: An infant has died, two other people seriously injured in Hobart fire

image.altText: pro-palestine protesters

props.synopsis: Pro-Palestinian protesters have gathered in Sydney and Melbourne, with many saying the Israel-Hamas ceasefire deal does not go far enough.

title.children: Thousands gather at pro-Palestine rallies ahead of Gaza ceasefire

image.altText: A man in a grey suit jacked with blue white and red tie looks up with sad eyes

props.synopsis: After a difficult start, 2025 promises to be the comeback year for King Charles. So what makes this monarch tick?

title.children: 'I'm not that stupid': How kingdom has changed Charles

image.altText: white utility truck in river

props.synopsis: A 53-year-old Queensland man was in a ute near Limpinwood, just south of the Queensland border, when he attempted to drive across a causeway.

title.children: Search for driver swept away by Tweed floodwater

image.altText: A visualisation created by UNSW with CSIRO data using gaming software Unreal showing  bushfire approaching a house.

props.synopsis: Film industry software is helping researchers study how climate factors influence bushfire behaviour. After another hottest year on record, climate change is heightening the risk of severe bushfires and pushing us to find creative solutions.

title.children: Gaming software shows what turns a fire into a catastrophic blaze

image.altText: Women wear red traditional beaded ethnic dress and take selfie with phone.

props.synopsis: By scaling back its independent fact-checking, Meta has triggered alarm among civil society groups in Asia where misinformation's consequences have proven deadly.

title.children: 'Dangerous times ahead': Warnings of misinformation surge as Meta retreats

image.altText: Rain falls over a dry red plain.

props.synopsis: Heavy rain is predicted for the Pilbara as a cyclone forms off WA. Weather authorities are warning coastal communities from Port Hedland to Exmouth could be facing strong winds and heavy rain for the next few days.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Sean warning upgraded as it travels down WA coast

image.altText: A group of cyclists compete in a race

props.synopsis: A female spectator is receiving treatment following a crash at the Tour Down Under on Saturday night.

title.children: Fan hospitalised following Tour Down Under crash

image.altText: NT Acting Coroner, Judge Elisabeth Armitage, sitting at a desk inside an office and reading papers in a file.

props.synopsis: The NT coroner has examined the history of two Aboriginal women killed by their partners, finding "systemic failings" in police's response to dozens of violent incidents preceding their deaths.

title.children: Coroner probes police actions in lead-up to DV deaths of two Darwin women

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Alsion Meagher stands behind a farm gate, smiling, with several cows behind her in a paddock filled with green grass.

props.synopsis: Qualified butcher, food stylist, cook, content creator and single mother Alison Meagher is well-versed in navigating busy periods. She shares how she finds balance and spends her downtime.

title.children: 'I just started running one day, and I didn't stop': How Alison finds balance in life

image.altText: People in a chairlift look up at rescuers dangling from cable above them

props.synopsis: A chairlift collapses at a winter resort in the Pyrenees mountains in the north of Spain, injuring dozens and leaving skiers stranded.

title.children: Skiers 'thrown off' chairlift during accident at Spanish resort

image.altText: A rugged mountainous island, viewed from the air.

props.synopsis: Ecotourism is drawing travellers across Australia, including on remote Lord Howe Island where Ian Sinclair and John Pemble got married after a morning spent pulling weeds.

title.children: Love grows among the weeds for ecotourism devotees

image.altText: A pregnant woman receives her COVID-19 shot in Pennsylvania, January 2021.

props.synopsis: RSV is a highly infectious virus that is the most common cause of respiratory infections in children.

title.children: What to know about RSV and the free vaccine coming in February

image.altText: A man with a serious expression on his face looks at the camera, while also displaying an image of several faces on his phone.

props.synopsis: Amer al-Sultan has been covering the war in Gaza as a reporter, but this week he became the story when nine members of his family were killed in an IDF strike two days before the Israel-Hamas ceasefire was due to begin.

title.children: Final preparations are under way for the Israel-Hamas ceasefire but it's too late for this family

image.altText: A small school of translucent fish in a jar in front of a wetland.

props.synopsis: The olive perchlet, a tiny translucent native fish last seen in the wild in Victoria about a century ago, is back from the brink of extinction.

title.children: Rare fish once extinct in Victoria is making a comeback

image.altText: GettyImages-2194615467

props.synopsis: With Taylor Swift in the stands, Travis Kelce and Patrick Mahomes put the Chiefs one step closer to another Super Bowl appearance. Later, Washington's miracle run continued with victory over Detroit.

title.children: Chiefs one win away from another Super Bowl, Washington miracle run continues

image.altText: A close up image of an SA Police car.

props.synopsis: A South Australian man has been arrested after trying to evade police by swimming into the ocean following a high-speed pursuit through Adelaide's western suburbs.

title.children: Driver swims into ocean to evade police following high-speed pursuit

image.altText: An aerial of one of the roundabouts with tyre maks from burnouts across the bitumen.

props.synopsis: On the edge of an industrial zone in Perth's eastern suburbs lay two roundabouts which have sat as roads to nowhere for more than five years.

title.children: Roundabouts just roads to nowhere as bridge plan in Perth's east stalls

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Still call yourself a trivia master? We'll see about that.

title.children: Convinced you're smarter than the rest of us? Prove it!

image.altText: Bright lights illuminate an outdoor concert stage with triple j banners around it. a large crowd watches the stage

props.synopsis: Ballina votes more than Byron, Launceston votes more than Hobart, and more than a few votes have come from international waters.

title.children: How Australia is voting so far in triple j's Hottest 100 of 2024

image.altText: GettyImages-2194468837

props.synopsis: Having already made her mark in the Big Bash, Caoimhe Bray stars for Australia on the world stage.

title.children: Aussie 15-year-old stars at U19 T20 World Cup with stunning bowling figures

image.altText: Ali Razini a man wearing a brown coat and a turban standing in front of a panel.

props.synopsis: Their killings, a rare attack targeting the judiciary, come as Iran faces economic turmoil.

title.children: Gunman in Iran's capital shoots dead two judges tied to 1988 mass executions

image.altText: Firefighters walk past a damaged road

props.synopsis: Russia attacks the Ukrainian capital with a barrage of drones and missiles, while industrial sites in Russia are set ablaze by Ukrainian strikes.

title.children: Kyiv hit by deadly Russian drone and missile strike
